laboratory_examinations.findings: CT abdomen shows small hypodensities in the liver that may represent cysts or biliary hamartomas; no concerning focal liver lesions or intra or extrahepatic biliary dilatation. The kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without evidence of hydronephrosis or focal lesions. CT pelvis shows a large amount of mesenteric fat stranding in the right lower quadrant surrounding a decompressed appendix with foci of extraluminal air concerning for perforated appendicitis.
Creatinine level is 2.5 mg/dL, which is below the normal range (ref range: 2.7 - 4.5 mg/dL).
